title: Calories in Jalapeno Poppers
meta_description: Discover calories in jalapeno poppers for a typical serving of 6, plus full nutrition breakdown including fat, carbs, protein, and preparation tweaks.
assumptions: Breaded and deep-fried, stuffed with cream cheese; average size ~30g each; no additional dipping sauce.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, filling, breading, and cooking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A serving of 6 jalapeno poppers contains about 540 kcal, mostly from fat in the cheese and frying.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one jalapeno popper?
faqs.a: About 90 kcal per breaded, fried jalapeno popper.

faqs.q: Are jalapeno poppers high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, 7 g fat per popper, mostly from cheese and frying oil.

faqs.q: What about carbs in jalapeno poppers?
faqs.a: Around 5 g carbs per popper, from the breading and pepper.

faqs.q: Do jalapeno poppers have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, about 200 mg per popper due to cheese and seasoning.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in jalapeno poppers?
faqs.a: Bake instead of fry, use low-fat cheese, or skip breading to cut 30-50 kcal per popper.
